meanings.definition: To be outperformed or outsmarted by an opposing coach in a competition or game.
meanings.sent1: The team felt defeated after being outcoached by their rival coach.
meanings.sent2: The coach knew they were outcoached when their strategy failed to work.
meanings.sent3: Despite their best efforts, they were outcoached by the opponent's clever moves.
meanings.sent4: Being outcoached felt like trying to solve a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of being outcoached lingered long after the game ended.

meanings.definition: To have been surpassed in coaching ability by another coach.
meanings.sent1: The coach realized they were outcoached when their team's performance declined.
meanings.sent2: Being outcoached motivated the coach to improve their skills.
meanings.sent3: The coach chuckled at the thought of being outcoached by a newcomer.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of being outcoached was a wake-up call to step up their game.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pride took a hit when they were outcoached in front of their team.
